0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eSupports item (\u003ccode\u003eint\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003efloat\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003elong\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003edecimal.Decimal\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003ebool\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003estr\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eunicode\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003edatetime\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003enone\u003c/code\u003e and other number-like objects) and collection (\u003ccode\u003elist\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eset\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etuple\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003edict\u003c/code\u003e, as well as iterable and dict-like objects) data types, with arbitrary nesting for the collections. Items with a \u003ccode\u003edatetime\u003c/code\u003e type are converted to ISO format strings. Items with a \u003ccode\u003eNone\u003c/code\u003e type become empty XML elements.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe root object passed into the \u003ccode\u003edicttoxml\u003c/code\u003e method can be any of the supported data types.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTo satisfy XML syntax, the method prepends an \u003ccode\u003e\u0026lt;?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\" ?\u0026gt;\u003c/code\u003e element and wraps the output in a \u003ccode\u003e\u0026lt;root\u0026gt; ... \u0026lt;/root\u0026gt;\u003c/code\u003e element. However, this can be disabled to create XML snippets. Alternately, a custom root element can be specified by passing in the optional \u003ccode\u003ecustom_root=foobar\u003c/code\u003e argument.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFor lists of items, if each item is also a collection data type (\u003ccode\u003elists\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003edict\u003c/code\u003e), the elements of that item are wrapped in a generic \u003ccode\u003e\u0026lt;item\u0026gt; ... \u0026lt;/item\u0026gt;\u003c/code\u003e element.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eEach element includes an optional \u003ccode\u003etype\u003c/code\u003e attribute with the data type. By default, the type attribute it included but it can be excluded by passing an optional \u003ccode\u003eattr_type=False\u003c/code\u003e argument when calling the \u003ccode\u003edicttoxml\u003c/code\u003e method.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eNote: \u003ccode\u003edatetime\u003c/code\u003e data types are converted into ISO format strings, and \u003ccode\u003eunicode\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003edatetime\u003c/code\u003e data types get a \u003ccode\u003estr\u003c/code\u003e attribute.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"Python -\u0026gt; XML\ninteger   int\nlong      long\nfloat     float\nDecimal   number\nstring    str\nunicode   str\ndatetime  str\nNone      null\nboolean   bool\nlist      list\nset       list\ntuple     list\ndict      dict\"\u003e\u003cpre class=\"notranslate\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003ePython -\u0026gt; XML\ninteger   int\nlong      long\nfloat     float\nDecimal   number\nstring    str\nunicode   str\ndatetime  str\nNone      null\nboolean   bool\nlist      list\nset       list\ntuple     list\ndict      dict\n\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eElements with an unsupported data type raise a TypeError exception.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIf an element name is invalid XML, it is rendered with the name \"key\" and the invalid name is included as a \u003ccode\u003ename\u003c/code\u003e attribute. E.g. \u003ccode\u003e{ \"^.{0,256}$\": \"foo\" }\u003c/code\u003e would be rendered \u003ccode\u003e\u0026lt;key name=\"^.{0,256}$\"\u0026gt;foo\u0026lt;/key\u0026gt;\u003c/code\u003e. An exception is element names with spaces, which are converted to underscores.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eThis module should work in Python 3.6+. 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eBy default, dicttoxml renders the XML element with an \u003ccode\u003eencoding=\"UTF-8\"\u003c/code\u003e attribute. Starting in version 1.7.6, you can change the encoding by using the optional \u003ccode\u003eencoding\u003c/code\u003e argument to the \u003ccode\u003edicttoxml\u003c/code\u003e method. For example, to render an XML file with encoding \"ISO-8859-1\", you would call:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(obj, encoding=\u0026quot;ISO-8859-1\u0026quot;)\"\u003e\u003cpre class=\"notranslate\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003e\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(obj, encoding=\"ISO-8859-1\")\n\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eOr if you prefer, you can suppress the encoding attribute altogether by setting the optional \u003ccode\u003einclude_encoding\u003c/code\u003e argument to \u003ccode\u003eFalse\u003c/code\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(obj, include_encoding=False)\"\u003e\u003cpre class=\"notranslate\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003e\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(obj, include_encoding=False)\n\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAgain, by default, the \u003ccode\u003einclude_encoding\u003c/code\u003e argument is set to \u003ccode\u003eTrue\u003c/code\u003e and the \u003ccode\u003eencoding\u003c/code\u003e argument is set to \u003ccode\u003eUTF-8\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch1 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eStarting in version 1.1, you can set an optional \u003ccode\u003eids\u003c/code\u003e parameter so that dicttoxml gives each element a unique \u003ccode\u003eid\u003c/code\u003e attribute.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eWith the \u003ccode\u003eids\u003c/code\u003e flag on, the function generates a unique randomly-generated ID for each element based on the parent element in the form \u003ccode\u003eparent_unique\u003c/code\u003e. For list items, the id is in the form \u003ccode\u003eparent_unique_index\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eContinuing with our example:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; xml_with_ids = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(obj, ids=True)\n\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; print(parseString(xml_with_ids).toprettyxml())\n\u0026lt;?xml version=\u0026quot;1.0\u0026quot; ?\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;root\u0026gt;\n        \u0026lt;mylist id=\u0026quot;root_160980\u0026quot; type=\u0026quot;list\u0026quot;\u0026gt;\n                \u0026lt;item id=\u0026quot;mylist_609405_1\u0026quot; type=\u0026quot;str\u0026quot;\u0026gt;foo\u0026lt;/item\u0026gt;\n                \u0026lt;item id=\u0026quot;mylist_609405_2\u0026quot; type=\u0026quot;str\u0026quot;\u0026gt;bar\u0026lt;/item\u0026gt;\n                \u0026lt;item id=\u0026quot;mylist_609405_3\u0026quot; type=\u0026quot;str\u0026quot;\u0026gt;baz\u0026lt;/item\u0026gt;\n        \u0026lt;/mylist\u0026gt;\n        \u0026lt;mydict id=\u0026quot;root_140407\u0026quot; type=\u0026quot;dict\u0026quot;\u0026gt;\n                \u0026lt;foo id=\u0026quot;mydict_260437\u0026quot; type=\u0026quot;str\u0026quot;\u0026gt;bar\u0026lt;/foo\u0026gt;\n                \u0026lt;baz id=\u0026quot;mydict_111194\u0026quot; type=\u0026quot;int\u0026quot;\u0026gt;1\u0026lt;/baz\u0026gt;\n        \u0026lt;/mydict\u0026gt;\n        \u0026lt;ok id=\u0026quot;root_612831\u0026quot; type=\u0026quot;bool\u0026quot;\u0026gt;true\u0026lt;/ok\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/root\u0026gt;\"\u003e\u003cpre class=\"notranslate\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003e\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; xml_with_ids = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(obj, ids=True)\n\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; print(parseString(xml_with_ids).toprettyxml())\n\u0026lt;?xml version=\"1.0\" ?\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;root\u0026gt;\n        \u0026lt;mylist id=\"root_160980\" type=\"list\"\u0026gt;\n                \u0026lt;item id=\"mylist_609405_1\" type=\"str\"\u0026gt;foo\u0026lt;/item\u0026gt;\n                \u0026lt;item id=\"mylist_609405_2\" type=\"str\"\u0026gt;bar\u0026lt;/item\u0026gt;\n                \u0026lt;item id=\"mylist_609405_3\" type=\"str\"\u0026gt;baz\u0026lt;/item\u0026gt;\n        \u0026lt;/mylist\u0026gt;\n        \u0026lt;mydict id=\"root_140407\" type=\"dict\"\u0026gt;\n                \u0026lt;foo id=\"mydict_260437\" type=\"str\"\u0026gt;bar\u0026lt;/foo\u0026gt;\n                \u0026lt;baz id=\"mydict_111194\" type=\"int\"\u0026gt;1\u0026lt;/baz\u0026gt;\n        \u0026lt;/mydict\u0026gt;\n        \u0026lt;ok id=\"root_612831\" type=\"bool\"\u0026gt;true\u0026lt;/ok\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/root\u0026gt;\n\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eNote that the default XML output remains the same as previous, so as not to break compatibility for existing uses.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eStarting in version 1.3, dicttoxml accepts dict-like objects that are derived from the \u003ccode\u003edict\u003c/code\u003e base class and treats them like dicts. For example:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; import collections\n\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; dictlike = collections.OrderedDict({'foo': 1, 'bar': 2, 'baz': 3})\n\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(dictlike)\n\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; print(xml)\n\u0026lt;?xml version=\u0026quot;1.0\u0026quot; encoding=\u0026quot;UTF-8\u0026quot; ?\u0026gt;\u0026lt;root\u0026gt;\u0026lt;baz type=\u0026quot;int\u0026quot;\u0026gt;3\u0026lt;/baz\u0026gt;\u0026lt;foo type=\u0026quot;int\u0026quot;\u0026gt;1\u0026lt;/foo\u0026gt;\u0026lt;bar type=\u0026quot;int\u0026quot;\u0026gt;2\u0026lt;/bar\u0026gt;\u0026lt;/root\u0026gt;\"\u003e\u003cpre class=\"notranslate\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003e\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; import collections\n\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; dictlike = collections.OrderedDict({'foo': 1, 'bar': 2, 'baz': 3})\n\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(dictlike)\n\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; print(xml)\n\u0026lt;?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\" ?\u0026gt;\u0026lt;root\u0026gt;\u0026lt;baz type=\"int\"\u0026gt;3\u0026lt;/baz\u0026gt;\u0026lt;foo type=\"int\"\u0026gt;1\u0026lt;/foo\u0026gt;\u0026lt;bar type=\"int\"\u0026gt;2\u0026lt;/bar\u0026gt;\u0026lt;/root\u0026gt;\n\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAlso starting in version 1.3, dicttoxml accepts iterable objects and treats them like lists. For example:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; myiter = range(1,11)\n\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(myiter)\n\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; print(xml)\n\u0026lt;?xml version=\u0026quot;1.0\u0026quot; encoding=\u0026quot;UTF-8\u0026quot; ?\u0026gt;\u0026lt;root\u0026gt;\u0026lt;item type=\u0026quot;int\u0026quot;\u0026gt;1\u0026lt;/item\u0026gt;\u0026lt;item type=\u0026quot;int\u0026quot;\u0026gt;2\u0026lt;/item\u0026gt;\u0026lt;item type=\u0026quot;int\u0026quot;\u0026gt;3\u0026lt;/item\u0026gt;\u0026lt;item type=\u0026quot;int\u0026quot;\u0026gt;4\u0026lt;/item\u0026gt;\u0026lt;item type=\u0026quot;int\u0026quot;\u0026gt;5\u0026lt;/item\u0026gt;\u0026lt;item type=\u0026quot;int\u0026quot;\u0026gt;6\u0026lt;/item\u0026gt;\u0026lt;item type=\u0026quot;int\u0026quot;\u0026gt;7\u0026lt;/item\u0026gt;\u0026lt;item type=\u0026quot;int\u0026quot;\u0026gt;8\u0026lt;/item\u0026gt;\u0026lt;item type=\u0026quot;int\u0026quot;\u0026gt;9\u0026lt;/item\u0026gt;\u0026lt;item type=\u0026quot;int\u0026quot;\u0026gt;10\u0026lt;/item\u0026gt;\u0026lt;/root\u0026gt;\"\u003e\u003cpre class=\"notranslate\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003e\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; myiter = range(1,11)\n\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(myiter)\n\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; print(xml)\n\u0026lt;?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\" ?\u0026gt;\u0026lt;root\u0026gt;\u0026lt;item type=\"int\"\u0026gt;1\u0026lt;/item\u0026gt;\u0026lt;item type=\"int\"\u0026gt;2\u0026lt;/item\u0026gt;\u0026lt;item type=\"int\"\u0026gt;3\u0026lt;/item\u0026gt;\u0026lt;item type=\"int\"\u0026gt;4\u0026lt;/item\u0026gt;\u0026lt;item type=\"int\"\u0026gt;5\u0026lt;/item\u0026gt;\u0026lt;item type=\"int\"\u0026gt;6\u0026lt;/item\u0026gt;\u0026lt;item type=\"int\"\u0026gt;7\u0026lt;/item\u0026gt;\u0026lt;item type=\"int\"\u0026gt;8\u0026lt;/item\u0026gt;\u0026lt;item type=\"int\"\u0026gt;9\u0026lt;/item\u0026gt;\u0026lt;item type=\"int\"\u0026gt;10\u0026lt;/item\u0026gt;\u0026lt;/root\u0026gt;\n\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAs always, this remains compatible with arbitrary nesting of objects and types.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch1 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eDefine Custom Item class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eStarting in version 1.7, if you don't want item elements in a list to be called 'item', you can specify the element name using a function that takes the parent element name (i.e. the list name) as an argument.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; import dicttoxml\n\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; obj = {u'mylist': [u'foo', u'bar', u'baz'], u'mydict': {u'foo': u'bar', u'baz': 1}, u'ok': True}\n\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; my_item_func = lambda x: 'list_item'\n\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(obj, item_func=my_item_func)\n\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; print(xml)\n\u0026lt;?xml version=\u0026quot;1.0\u0026quot; encoding=\u0026quot;UTF-8\u0026quot; ?\u0026gt;\u0026lt;root\u0026gt;\u0026lt;mydict type=\u0026quot;dict\u0026quot;\u0026gt;\u0026lt;foo type=\u0026quot;str\u0026quot;\u0026gt;bar\u0026lt;/foo\u0026gt;\u0026lt;baz type=\u0026quot;int\u0026quot;\u0026gt;1\u0026lt;/baz\u0026gt;\u0026lt;/mydict\u0026gt;\u0026lt;mylist type=\u0026quot;list\u0026quot;\u0026gt;\u0026lt;list_item type=\u0026quot;str\u0026quot;\u0026gt;foo\u0026lt;/list_item\u0026gt;\u0026lt;list_item type=\u0026quot;str\u0026quot;\u0026gt;bar\u0026lt;/list_item\u0026gt;\u0026lt;list_item type=\u0026quot;str\u0026quot;\u0026gt;baz\u0026lt;/list_item\u0026gt;\u0026lt;/mylist\u0026gt;\u0026lt;ok type=\u0026quot;bool\u0026quot;\u0026gt;True\u0026lt;/ok\u0026gt;\u0026lt;/root\u0026gt;\"\u003e\u003cpre class=\"notranslate\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003e\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; import dicttoxml\n\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; obj = {u'mylist': [u'foo', u'bar', u'baz'], u'mydict': {u'foo': u'bar', u'baz': 1}, u'ok': True}\n\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; my_item_func = lambda x: 'list_item'\n\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(obj, item_func=my_item_func)\n\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; print(xml)\n\u0026lt;?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\" ?\u0026gt;\u0026lt;root\u0026gt;\u0026lt;mydict type=\"dict\"\u0026gt;\u0026lt;foo type=\"str\"\u0026gt;bar\u0026lt;/foo\u0026gt;\u0026lt;baz type=\"int\"\u0026gt;1\u0026lt;/baz\u0026gt;\u0026lt;/mydict\u0026gt;\u0026lt;mylist type=\"list\"\u0026gt;\u0026lt;list_item type=\"str\"\u0026gt;foo\u0026lt;/list_item\u0026gt;\u0026lt;list_item type=\"str\"\u0026gt;bar\u0026lt;/list_item\u0026gt;\u0026lt;list_item type=\"str\"\u0026gt;baz\u0026lt;/list_item\u0026gt;\u0026lt;/mylist\u0026gt;\u0026lt;ok type=\"bool\"\u0026gt;True\u0026lt;/ok\u0026gt;\u0026lt;/root\u0026gt;\n\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe benefit of taking the parent element name as an argument is that you can write the function to do something with it. Let's say you have an object with some lists of specific items:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; obj = {'shrubs': ['abelia', 'aralia', 'aucuba', 'azalea', 'bamboo', 'barberry', 'bluebeard', 'boxwood', 'camellia', 'dogwood', 'elderberry', 'enkianthus', 'firethorn', 'fuchsia', 'hazel', 'heath', 'heather', 'holly', 'honeysuckle', 'hydrangea', 'laurel', 'lilac', 'mock orange', 'rhododendron', 'rose', 'rose of sharon', 'rosemary', 'smokebush', 'spirea', 'sweetbox', 'viburnum', 'weigela', 'yucca'], 'trees': ['ash', 'aspen', 'birch', 'butternut', 'cedar', 'cottonwood', 'elm', 'fir', 'hawthorn', 'larch', 'locust', 'maple', 'oak', 'pine', 'spruce', 'sycamore', 'willow']}\"\u003e\u003cpre class=\"notranslate\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003e\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; obj = {'shrubs': ['abelia', 'aralia', 'aucuba', 'azalea', 'bamboo', 'barberry', 'bluebeard', 'boxwood', 'camellia', 'dogwood', 'elderberry', 'enkianthus', 'firethorn', 'fuchsia', 'hazel', 'heath', 'heather', 'holly', 'honeysuckle', 'hydrangea', 'laurel', 'lilac', 'mock orange', 'rhododendron', 'rose', 'rose of sharon', 'rosemary', 'smokebush', 'spirea', 'sweetbox', 'viburnum', 'weigela', 'yucca'], 'trees': ['ash', 'aspen', 'birch', 'butternut', 'cedar', 'cottonwood', 'elm', 'fir', 'hawthorn', 'larch', 'locust', 'maple', 'oak', 'pine', 'spruce', 'sycamore', 'willow']}\n\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eYou can define each item name to be the singular of its parent name by returning all but the last character.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; my_item_func = lambda x: x[:-1]\n\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(obj, item_func=my_item_func)\n\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; print(xml)\n\u0026lt;?xml version=\u0026quot;1.0\u0026quot; encoding=\u0026quot;UTF-8\u0026quot; ?\u0026gt;\u0026lt;root\u0026gt;\u0026lt;shrubs type=\u0026quot;list\u0026quot;\u0026gt;\u0026lt;shrub type=\u0026quot;str\u0026quot;\u0026gt;abelia\u0026lt;/shrub\u0026gt;\u0026lt;shrub from xml.dom.minidom import parseString\n\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; dom = parseString(xml)\n\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt; print(dom.toprettyxml())\n\u0026lt;?xml version=\"1.0\" ?\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;root\u0026gt;\n    \u0026lt;mylist type=\"list\"\u0026gt;\n        \u0026lt;item type=\"str\"\u0026gt;foo\u0026lt;/item\u0026gt;\n        \u0026lt;item type=\"str\"\u0026gt;bar\u0026lt;/item\u0026gt;\n        \u0026lt;item type=\"str\"\u0026gt;baz\u0026lt;/item\u0026gt;\n    \u0026lt;/mylist\u0026gt;\n    \u0026lt;mydict type=\"dict\"\u0026gt;\n        \u0026lt;foo type=\"str\"\u0026gt;bar\u0026lt;/foo\u0026gt;\n        \u0026lt;baz type=\"int\"\u0026gt;1\u0026lt;/baz\u0026gt;\n    \u0026lt;/mydict\u0026gt;\n    \u0026lt;ok type=\"bool\"\u0026gt;true\u0026lt;/ok\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/root\u0026gt;\n\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThis makes the XML easier to read. This is the first in a series of updates I will be pushing over the next couple of months to get caught up on the backlog of issues and pull requests.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded ability to customize \u003ccode\u003elist\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003edict\u003c/code\u003e item names via a function argument passed into the \u003ccode\u003edicttoxml()\u003c/code\u003e function. itemprop="text"><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h1 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Summary</h1><a id="user-content-summary" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Summary" href="#summary"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Converts a Python dictionary or other native data type into a valid XML string.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h1 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Details</h1><a id="user-content-details" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Details" href="#details"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Supports item (<code>int</code>, <code>float</code>, <code>long</code>, <code>decimal.Decimal</code>, <code>bool</code>, <code>str</code>, <code>unicode</code>, <code>datetime</code>, <code>none</code> and other number-like objects) and collection (<code>list</code>, <code>set</code>, <code>tuple</code> and <code>dict</code>, as well as iterable and dict-like objects) data types, with arbitrary nesting for the collections. Items with a <code>datetime</code> type are converted to ISO format strings. Items with a <code>None</code> type become empty XML elements.</p><p dir="auto">The root object passed into the <code>dicttoxml</code> method can be any of the supported data types.</p><p dir="auto">To satisfy XML syntax, the method prepends an <code><?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?></code> element and wraps the output in a <code><root> ... </root></code> element. However, this can be disabled to create XML snippets. Alternately, a custom root element can be specified by passing in the optional <code>custom_root=foobar</code> argument.</p><p dir="auto">For lists of items, if each item is also a collection data type (<code>lists</code>, <code>dict</code>), the elements of that item are wrapped in a generic <code><item> ... </item></code> element.</p><p dir="auto">Each element includes an optional <code>type</code> attribute with the data type. By default, the type attribute it included but it can be excluded by passing an optional <code>attr_type=False</code> argument when calling the <code>dicttoxml</code> method.</p><p dir="auto">Note: <code>datetime</code> data types are converted into ISO format strings, and <code>unicode</code> and <code>datetime</code> data types get a <code>str</code> attribute.</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="Python -> XMLinteger   intlong      longfloat     floatDecimal   numberstring    strunicode   strdatetime  strNone      nullboolean   boollist      listset       listtuple     listdict      dict"><pre class="notranslate"><code>Python -> XMLinteger   intlong      longfloat     floatDecimal   numberstring    strunicode   strdatetime  strNone      nullboolean   boollist      listset       listtuple     listdict      dict</code></pre></div><p dir="auto">Elements with an unsupported data type raise a TypeError exception.</p><p dir="auto">If an element name is invalid XML, it is rendered with the name "key" and the invalid name is included as a <code>name</code> attribute. E.g. <code>{ "^.{0,256}$": "foo" }</code> would be rendered <code><key name="^.{0,256}$">foo</key></code>. An exception is element names with spaces, which are converted to underscores.</p><p dir="auto"><strong>This module should work in Python 3.6+. You might be able to get it to work in Python 2.x but that is no longer supported.</strong></p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h1 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Installation</h1><a id="user-content-installation" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Installation" href="#installation"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">The dicttoxml module is <a href="https://pypi.python.org/pypi/dicttoxml" rel="nofollow">published on the Python Package Index</a>, so you can install it using <code>pip</code>.</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="pip install dicttoxml"><pre class="notranslate"><code>pip install dicttoxml</code></pre></div><p dir="auto">Alternately, you can download the tarballed installer - <code>dicttoxml-[VERSION].tar.gz</code> - for this package from the <a href="https://github.com/quandyfactory/dicttoxml/tree/master/dist">dist</a> directory on github and uncompress it. Then, from a terminal or command window, navigate into the unzipped folder and type the command:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="python setup.py install"><pre class="notranslate"><code>python setup.py install</code></pre></div><p dir="auto">That should be all you need to do.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h1 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Basic Usage</h1><a id="user-content-basic-usage" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Basic Usage" href="#basic-usage"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Once installed, import the library into your script and convert a dict into xml by running the <code>dicttoxml</code> function:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=">>> import dicttoxml>>> xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(some_dict)"><pre class="notranslate"><code>>>> import dicttoxml>>> xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(some_dict)</code></pre></div><p dir="auto">Alternately, you can import the <code>dicttoxml()</code> function from the library.</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=">>> from dicttoxml import dicttoxml>>> xml = dicttoxml(some_dict)"><pre class="notranslate"><code>>>> from dicttoxml import dicttoxml>>> xml = dicttoxml(some_dict)</code></pre></div><p dir="auto">That's it!</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h1 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">JSON to XML</h1><a id="user-content-json-to-xml" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: JSON to XML" href="#json-to-xml"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Let's say you want to fetch a JSON object from a URL and convert it into XML. Here's how you can do that:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=">>> import json>>> import urllib>>> import dicttoxml>>> page = urllib.urlopen('http://quandyfactory.com/api/example')>>> content = page.read()>>> obj = json.loads(content)>>> print(obj){u'mylist': [u'foo', u'bar', u'baz'], u'mydict': {u'foo': u'bar', u'baz': 1}, u'ok': True}>>> xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(obj)>>> print(xml)<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?><root><mylist><item type="str">foo</item><item type="str">bar</item><item type="str">baz</item></mylist><mydict><foo type="str">bar</foo><baz type="int">1</baz></mydict><ok type="bool">true</ok></root>"><pre class="notranslate"><code>>>> import json>>> import urllib>>> import dicttoxml>>> page = urllib.urlopen('http://quandyfactory.com/api/example')>>> content = page.read()>>> obj = json.loads(content)>>> print(obj){u'mylist': [u'foo', u'bar', u'baz'], u'mydict': {u'foo': u'bar', u'baz': 1}, u'ok': True}>>> xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(obj)>>> print(xml)<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?><root><mylist><item type="str">foo</item><item type="str">bar</item><item type="str">baz</item></mylist><mydict><foo type="str">bar</foo><baz type="int">1</baz></mydict><ok type="bool">true</ok></root></code></pre></div><p dir="auto">It's that simple.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h1 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">XML Snippet</h1><a id="user-content-xml-snippet" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: XML Snippet" href="#xml-snippet"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Instead of creating a full XML document, you can create an XML snippet for inclusion into another XML document.</p><p dir="auto">Continuing with the example from above:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=">>> xml_snippet = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(obj, root=False)>>> print(xml_snippet)<mylist><item type="str">foo</item><item type="str">bar</item><item type="str">baz</item></mylist><mydict><foo type="str">bar</foo><baz type="int">1</baz></mydict><ok type="bool">true</ok>"><pre class="notranslate"><code>>>> xml_snippet = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(obj, root=False)>>> print(xml_snippet)<mylist><item type="str">foo</item><item type="str">bar</item><item type="str">baz</item></mylist><mydict><foo type="str">bar</foo><baz type="int">1</baz></mydict><ok type="bool">true</ok></code></pre></div><p dir="auto">With the optional <code>root</code> argument set to <code>False</code>, the method converts the dict into XML without including an <code><?xml></code> prolog or a <code><root></code> element to enclose all the other elements.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h1 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Custom Root</h1><a id="user-content-custom-root" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Custom Root" href="#custom-root"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">By default, dicttoxml wraps all the elements in a <code><root> ... </root></code> element. Starting in version 1.5, you can change the name of the root element to something else by passing an optional <code>custom_root=some_custom_root</code> argument to the <code>dicttoxml</code> method.</p><p dir="auto">Using our example:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=">>> xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(obj, custom_root='some_custom_root')>>> print(xml)<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?><some_custom_root><mydict><foo>bar</foo><baz>1</baz></mydict><mylist><item>foo</item><item>bar</item><item>baz</item></mylist><ok>true</ok></some_custom_root>"><pre class="notranslate"><code>>>> xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(obj, custom_root='some_custom_root')>>> print(xml)<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?><some_custom_root><mydict><foo>bar</foo><baz>1</baz></mydict><mylist><item>foo</item><item>bar</item><item>baz</item></mylist><ok>true</ok></some_custom_root></code></pre></div><p dir="auto">As you can see, the name of the root element has changed to <code>some_custom_root</code>.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h1 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Omit XML Declaration</h1><a id="user-content-omit-xml-declaration" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Omit XML Declaration" href="#omit-xml-declaration"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Perhaps you want your outputted XML to have a <code>root</code> but no XML declaration. Starting with version 1.7.15, can call <code>dicttoxml</code> with the optional <code>xml_declaration</code> argument set to <code>False</code>:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=">>> xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(xml_declaration=False)>>> print(xml)<root><ok type="bool">true</ok><mylist type="list"><item type="str">foo</item><item type="str">bar</item><item type="str">baz</item></mylist><mydict type="dict"><foo type="str">bar</foo><baz type="int">1</baz></mydict></root>"><pre class="notranslate"><code>>>> xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(xml_declaration=False)>>> print(xml)<root><ok type="bool">true</ok><mylist type="list"><item type="str">foo</item><item type="str">bar</item><item type="str">baz</item></mylist><mydict type="dict"><foo type="str">bar</foo><baz type="int">1</baz></mydict></root></code></pre></div><p dir="auto">As you can see, the XML declaration has been omitted.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h1 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Disable Type Attributes</h1><a id="user-content-disable-type-attributes" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Disable Type Attributes" href="#disable-type-attributes"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">By default, dicttoxml includes a type attribute for each element. Starting in version 1.4, you can turn this off by passing an optional <code>attr_type=False</code> argument to the <code>dicttoxml</code> method.</p><p dir="auto">Using our example:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=">>> xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(obj, attr_type=False)>>> print(xml)<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?><root><mydict><foo>bar</foo><baz>1</baz></mydict><mylist><item>foo</item><item>bar</item><item>baz</item></mylist><ok>true</ok></root>"><pre class="notranslate"><code>>>> xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(obj, attr_type=False)>>> print(xml)<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?><root><mydict><foo>bar</foo><baz>1</baz></mydict><mylist><item>foo</item><item>bar</item><item>baz</item></mylist><ok>true</ok></root></code></pre></div><p dir="auto">As you can see, the only difference is that the type attributes are now absent.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h1 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Change or Suppress XML Encoding Attribute</h1><a id="user-content-change-or-suppress-xml-encoding-attribute" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Change or Suppress XML Encoding Attribute" href="#change-or-suppress-xml-encoding-attribute"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">By default, dicttoxml renders the XML element with an <code>encoding="UTF-8"</code> attribute. Starting in version 1.7.6, you can change the encoding by using the optional <code>encoding</code> argument to the <code>dicttoxml</code> method. For example, to render an XML file with encoding "ISO-8859-1", you would call:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=">>> xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(obj, encoding="ISO-8859-1")"><pre class="notranslate"><code>>>> xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(obj, encoding="ISO-8859-1")</code></pre></div><p dir="auto">Or if you prefer, you can suppress the encoding attribute altogether by setting the optional <code>include_encoding</code> argument to <code>False</code>:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=">>> xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(obj, include_encoding=False)"><pre class="notranslate"><code>>>> xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(obj, include_encoding=False)</code></pre></div><p dir="auto">Again, by default, the <code>include_encoding</code> argument is set to <code>True</code> and the <code>encoding</code> argument is set to <code>UTF-8</code>.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h1 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Unique ID Attributes</h1><a id="user-content-unique-id-attributes" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Unique ID Attributes" href="#unique-id-attributes"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Starting in version 1.1, you can set an optional <code>ids</code> parameter so that dicttoxml gives each element a unique <code>id</code> attribute.</p><p dir="auto">With the <code>ids</code> flag on, the function generates a unique randomly-generated ID for each element based on the parent element in the form <code>parent_unique</code>. For list items, the id is in the form <code>parent_unique_index</code>.</p><p dir="auto">Continuing with our example:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=">>> xml_with_ids = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(obj, ids=True)>>> print(parseString(xml_with_ids).toprettyxml())<?xml version="1.0" ?><root>        <mylist id="root_160980" type="list">                <item id="mylist_609405_1" type="str">foo</item>                <item id="mylist_609405_2" type="str">bar</item>                <item id="mylist_609405_3" type="str">baz</item>        </mylist>        <mydict id="root_140407" type="dict">                <foo id="mydict_260437" type="str">bar</foo>                <baz id="mydict_111194" type="int">1</baz>        </mydict>        <ok id="root_612831" type="bool">true</ok></root>"><pre class="notranslate"><code>>>> xml_with_ids = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(obj, ids=True)>>> print(parseString(xml_with_ids).toprettyxml())<?xml version="1.0" ?><root>        <mylist id="root_160980" type="list">                <item id="mylist_609405_1" type="str">foo</item>                <item id="mylist_609405_2" type="str">bar</item>                <item id="mylist_609405_3" type="str">baz</item>        </mylist>        <mydict id="root_140407" type="dict">                <foo id="mydict_260437" type="str">bar</foo>                <baz id="mydict_111194" type="int">1</baz>        </mydict>        <ok id="root_612831" type="bool">true</ok></root></code></pre></div><p dir="auto">Note that the default XML output remains the same as previous, so as not to break compatibility for existing uses.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h1 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Dict-Like and Iterable Objects</h1><a id="user-content-dict-like-and-iterable-objects" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Dict-Like and Iterable Objects" href="#dict-like-and-iterable-objects"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Starting in version 1.3, dicttoxml accepts dict-like objects that are derived from the <code>dict</code> base class and treats them like dicts. For example:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=">>> import collections>>> dictlike = collections.OrderedDict({'foo': 1, 'bar': 2, 'baz': 3})>>> xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(dictlike)>>> print(xml)<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?><root><baz type="int">3</baz><foo type="int">1</foo><bar type="int">2</bar></root>"><pre class="notranslate"><code>>>> import collections>>> dictlike = collections.OrderedDict({'foo': 1, 'bar': 2, 'baz': 3})>>> xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(dictlike)>>> print(xml)<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?><root><baz type="int">3</baz><foo type="int">1</foo><bar type="int">2</bar></root></code></pre></div><p dir="auto">Also starting in version 1.3, dicttoxml accepts iterable objects and treats them like lists. For example:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=">>> myiter = range(1,11)>>> xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(myiter)>>> print(xml)<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?><root><item type="int">1</item><item type="int">2</item><item type="int">3</item><item type="int">4</item><item type="int">5</item><item type="int">6</item><item type="int">7</item><item type="int">8</item><item type="int">9</item><item type="int">10</item></root>"><pre class="notranslate"><code>>>> myiter = range(1,11)>>> xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(myiter)>>> print(xml)<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?><root><item type="int">1</item><item type="int">2</item><item type="int">3</item><item type="int">4</item><item type="int">5</item><item type="int">6</item><item type="int">7</item><item type="int">8</item><item type="int">9</item><item type="int">10</item></root></code></pre></div><p dir="auto">As always, this remains compatible with arbitrary nesting of objects and types.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h1 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Define Custom Item Names</h1><a id="user-content-define-custom-item-names" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Define Custom Item Names" href="#define-custom-item-names"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Starting in version 1.7, if you don't want item elements in a list to be called 'item', you can specify the element name using a function that takes the parent element name (i.e. the list name) as an argument.</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=">>> import dicttoxml>>> obj = {u'mylist': [u'foo', u'bar', u'baz'], u'mydict': {u'foo': u'bar', u'baz': 1}, u'ok': True}>>> my_item_func = lambda x: 'list_item'>>> xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(obj, item_func=my_item_func)>>> print(xml)<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?><root><mydict type="dict"><foo type="str">bar</foo><baz type="int">1</baz></mydict><mylist type="list"><list_item type="str">foo</list_item><list_item type="str">bar</list_item><list_item type="str">baz</list_item></mylist><ok type="bool">True</ok></root>"><pre class="notranslate"><code>>>> import dicttoxml>>> obj = {u'mylist': [u'foo', u'bar', u'baz'], u'mydict': {u'foo': u'bar', u'baz': 1}, u'ok': True}>>> my_item_func = lambda x: 'list_item'>>> xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(obj, item_func=my_item_func)>>> print(xml)<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?><root><mydict type="dict"><foo type="str">bar</foo><baz type="int">1</baz></mydict><mylist type="list"><list_item type="str">foo</list_item><list_item type="str">bar</list_item><list_item type="str">baz</list_item></mylist><ok type="bool">True</ok></root></code></pre></div><p dir="auto">The benefit of taking the parent element name as an argument is that you can write the function to do something with it. Let's say you have an object with some lists of specific items:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=">>> obj = {'shrubs': ['abelia', 'aralia', 'aucuba', 'azalea', 'bamboo', 'barberry', 'bluebeard', 'boxwood', 'camellia', 'dogwood', 'elderberry', 'enkianthus', 'firethorn', 'fuchsia', 'hazel', 'heath', 'heather', 'holly', 'honeysuckle', 'hydrangea', 'laurel', 'lilac', 'mock orange', 'rhododendron', 'rose', 'rose of sharon', 'rosemary', 'smokebush', 'spirea', 'sweetbox', 'viburnum', 'weigela', 'yucca'], 'trees': ['ash', 'aspen', 'birch', 'butternut', 'cedar', 'cottonwood', 'elm', 'fir', 'hawthorn', 'larch', 'locust', 'maple', 'oak', 'pine', 'spruce', 'sycamore', 'willow']}"><pre class="notranslate"><code>>>> obj = {'shrubs': ['abelia', 'aralia', 'aucuba', 'azalea', 'bamboo', 'barberry', 'bluebeard', 'boxwood', 'camellia', 'dogwood', 'elderberry', 'enkianthus', 'firethorn', 'fuchsia', 'hazel', 'heath', 'heather', 'holly', 'honeysuckle', 'hydrangea', 'laurel', 'lilac', 'mock orange', 'rhododendron', 'rose', 'rose of sharon', 'rosemary', 'smokebush', 'spirea', 'sweetbox', 'willow']}</code></pre></div><p dir="auto">You can define each item name to be the singular of its parent name by returning all but the last character.</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content optional <code>cdata</code> argument to <code>True</code>.</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=">>> import dicttoxml>>> obj = {u'mylist': [u'foo', u'bar', u'baz'], u'mydict': {u'foo': u'bar', u'baz': 1}, u'ok': True}>>> xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(obj, cdata=True)>>> print(xml)<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?><root><mydict type="dict"><foo type="str"><![CDATA[bar]]></foo><baz type="int"><![CDATA[1]]></baz></mydict><mylist type="list"><item type="str"><![CDATA[foo]]></item><item type="str"><![CDATA[bar]]></item><item type="str"><![CDATA[baz]]></item></mylist><ok type="bool"><![CDATA[True]]></ok></root>"><pre class="notranslate"><code>>>> import dicttoxml>>> obj = {u'mylist': [u'foo', u'bar', u'baz'], u'mydict': {u'foo': u'bar', u'baz': 1}, u'ok': True}>>> xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(obj, cdata=True)>>> print(xml)<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?><root><mydict type="dict"><foo type="str"><![CDATA[bar]]></foo><baz type="int"><![CDATA[1]]></baz></mydict><mylist type="list"><item type="str"><![CDATA[foo]]></item><item type="str"><![CDATA[bar]]></item><item type="str"><![CDATA[baz]]></item></mylist><ok type="bool"><![CDATA[True]]></ok></root></code></pre></div><p dir="auto">If you do not set <code>cdata</code> to <code>True</code>, the default value is <code>False</code> and values are not wrapped.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h1 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Return a String</h1><a id="user-content-return-a-string" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Return a String" href="#return-a-string"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">By default, dicttoxml outputs the generated XML as a <code>bytes</code> object:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=">>> xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(obj)>>> type(xml).__name__'bytes'"><pre class="notranslate"><code>>>> xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(obj)>>> type(xml).__name__'bytes'</code></pre></div><p dir="auto">Starting in version 1.7.14, when you call the dicttoxml function, you can set an optional <code>return_bytes</code> argument to <code>False</code> to return a <code>str</code> object instead:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=">>> xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(obj, return_bytes=False)>>> type(xml).__name__'str'"><pre class="notranslate"><code>>>> xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(obj, return_bytes=False)>>> type(xml).__name__'str'</code></pre></div><p dir="auto">But by default, <code>return_bytes</code> is set to <code>True</code>.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h1 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Pretty-Printing</h1><a id="user-content-pretty-printing" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Pretty-Printing" href="#pretty-printing"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">As they say, Python comes with batteries included. You can easily syntax-check and pretty-print your XML using Python's <code>xml.dom.minidom</code> module.</p><p dir="auto">Again, continuing with our example:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=">>> from xml.dom.minidom import parseString>>> dom = parseString(xml)>>> print(dom.toprettyxml())<?xml version="1.0" ?><root>    <mylist type="list">        <item type="str">foo</item>        <item type="str">bar</item>        <item type="str">baz</item>    </mylist>    <mydict type="dict">        <foo type="str">bar</foo>        <baz type="int">1</baz>    </mydict>    <ok type="bool">true</ok></root>"><pre class="notranslate"><code>>>> from xml.dom.minidom import parseString>>> dom = parseString(xml)>>> print(dom.toprettyxml())<?xml version="1.0" ?><root>    <mylist type="list">        <item type="str">foo</item>        <item type="str">bar</item>        <item type="str">baz</item>    </mylist>    <mydict type="dict">        <foo type="str">bar</foo>        <baz type="int">1</baz>    </mydict>    <ok type="bool">true</ok></root></code></pre></div><p dir="auto">This makes the XML easier to read. If it is not well-formed, the xml parser will raise an exception.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h1 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Debugging</h1><a id="user-content-debugging" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Debugging" href="#debugging"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">You can enable debugging informationby calling the <code>set_debug()</code> method:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=">>> import dicttoxml>>> dicttoxml.set_debug(debug=True)Debug mode is on. Events are logged at: dicttoxml.log>>> xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(some_dict)"><pre class="notranslate"><code>>>> import dicttoxml>>> dicttoxml.set_debug(debug=True)Debug mode is on. Events are logged at: dicttoxml.log>>> xml = dicttoxml.dicttoxml(some_dict)</code></pre></div><p dir="auto">By default, debugging information is logged to <code>dicttoxml.log</code>, but you can change this:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=">>> dicttoxml.set_debug(debug=True, filename='/path/to/some_other_filename.log')Debug mode is on. Events are logged at: some_other_filename.log"><pre class="notranslate"><code>>>> dicttoxml.set_debug(debug=True, filename='/path/to/some_other_filename.log')Debug mode is on. Events are logged at: some_other_filename.log</code></pre></div><p dir="auto">To turn debug mode off, just call <code>set_debug</code> with an argument of <code>False</code>:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=">>> dicttoxml.set_debug(debug=False)"><pre class="notranslate"><code>>>> dicttoxml.set_debug(debug=False)</code></pre></div><p dir="auto">If you encounter any errors in the code, please file an issue on github: <a href="https://github.com/quandyfactory/dicttoxml/issues">https://github.com/quandyfactory/dicttoxml/issues</a>.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h1 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element"
